data.title: Drop support for Mono 2.6 and 2.8
data.body:
Did a short check on the versions of Mono in Linux distributions that are not EOL:
- supported Fedora/OpenSUSE ship >= 2.10.5
- Ubuntu also ships >= 2.10.5 and the oldest Ubuntu LTS has http://badgerports.org/lucid.html has been updated to 2.10.8.1 which is the latest on Debian Wheezy, too.
- Arch/Gentoo ship 2.10.8 and 2.10.9

Therefore I think it is safe to drop all strange workarounds in the source code (which and where?) as well as maybe switch safely to `xbuild` (unifying both ways to compile) as described in #2533.

data.title: Support for Mono 3
data.body: Works fine using http://www.mono-project.com/Release_Notes_Mono_3.0.3 Might be interesting because the performance of the GC is said to be improved.

data.title: Point to the syncreport.log when crashing due to desync.
data.body: Most bug-reports investigating sync-problems are useless because people only post their exception.log (few people read the FAQ) so I made the exception message more verbose as we already point to graphics.log when the renderer crashes.

data.title: [minor] missing move click feedback animation
data.body: While playing RA1 to see how the original left-click behavior was, I noticed that you also get a visual feedback on move orders. I think it is the SHP we use for rally-point (not the flag, the circle) only remapped to shadow colors and animated.

data.title: Wish list for further work on Holloweyes advanced yamls
data.body:
It's going to be awesome..
But how can we get the full potential out?

Wishlist:
- support for audio when certain conditions are met: ,
  - "Nice move, now the real attack comes"
  - "The enemies hiding in civilians buildings, take them out"
- missions information like Scott's tab, not only messages
- changes of conditions:
  - "no flying conditions, leave planes on ground"
- All your units upgraded to veteran status
- capture the flag (crates)
  - Could also be tech in crates
- suddently gps on and off (makes it easier / harder)
- flares showing where the attack comes
- VIP moves on the map, you can view his movement, try to take him out
- a second factions come in, UN, tries to kill all the players (I think this already work, but you should be able to have them white, alas: define colors for factions, different color of AI in each wave?)
- winning condition when x units are healed (doctor mission, save the civilians from waves)
- spawn custom units (first the one that are found in Openra, later with shp), like spawning seamonsters, but first some subs that emerges on the map. Also later sandworms on D2k
- crate collection missions with AI also trying to get them, first to 15 crates win
- one player with air, one with naval, one with ground units, one with defence buildings, wave will attack
- spawning of buildings, like oil wells build, new civilian buildings spawn
- AI takes control of some of your units, rebels or mutiny
- custom sounds: "units chatter, or ppl screaming before waves"
- enemy chrone in units
- humvee chasing missions
- civilian dogs, evil, spawns at random
- convoy, make sure the supply trucks reaches your base, or civilian base with aid
- stop the suicidal demo trucks (I guess this works)
- Enemy attacks with transport choppers, transport ships and apc's (I guess this works, but not where they deploy)

Stealing a lot of ideas from: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Mapping-modding-Ideas and Scott's missions and nukems ?imported legacy? ones

data.title: Travis CI support
data.body: This will check the _bleed_ branch if it compiles and announce the build results in IRC after each commit and it checks incoming pull requests automatically. It might also need to be set up to allow access to the GitHub API. I just registered my branch for testing. Can't access the settings of https://github.com/OpenRA. To have it fail on warnings I had to have `make` fail on warnings.

data.title: Warning
data.body: Test Travis CI if it breaks on warnings.

data.title: Rebalance Unit Crates
data.body:
Right now, they can give a faction any unit from the list of units available to them. This can be massively overpowered the first few minutes of a game however, especially if a tech 10 unit if acquired at tech 1. 

I recommend adding a check to see if the player has necessary prerequisites for that unit before spawning it. Otherwise, it will choose another unit that the player can build. 
For example
A player picks up a unit crate the first few minutes of a game. The games tells the crate to spawn a mammoth tank, however the player does not have a tech center yet. So the game instead finds another unit the player can build, like a squad of dogs or riflemen.

It should not limit units between factions (an allied player should still be able to acquire a mammoth tank) but it needs to check for prerequisites (an allied player needs a tech center to acquire a mammoth tank)

data.title: Reduce sell value of starting construction yard to 1
data.body:
Just as the title says, reduce the value of the start construction yard to one. This will stop an exploit that allows players to sell their first construction yard in exchange for an MCV crate and 1000 dollars. This should not apply to all bought construction yards however.

I have an idea on how to implement this with current code, but it might not work.

data.title: Allow Installation of playtests next to stable releases
data.body:
Requires for Linux:
- installation into different paths like `/usr/lib/openra-playtest`
- different startup scripts `openra-playtest`
- packages need renaming to `openra-playtest`

data.title: Asynchronous loading of map previews in the map chooser dialog
data.body:
Added async loading of map previews in the map chooses dialog based on the idea from Pull request 5.

The problem with it was that while the items _were_ added asynchronously to the list, the actual map loading was done in the GUI thread since the map was first loaded and added to the cache in the Draw() override of the MapPreviewWidget.

I have added a method that forces loading the map preview into the cache and that can be called from another thread.

data.title: Auto map downloading implementation in sync mode
Add classic left-click orders
data.body: This adds the most frequently found wish on Facebook and ModDB. It is based on the HotkeyAddon branch by @TiriliPiitPiit (reversed commit 9a655d1a46fc631b5fe27074acdab00c2d6e1717 and http://dpaste.com/874285/) as well as https://github.com/Iran/ClassicRA/blob/master/OpenRA.Game/Widgets/WorldInteractionControllerWidget.cs by @Iran with some changes to fix known issues and keep it optional. More tricky than expected.

data.body: I get the above error when trying to download the game content for Red Alert using the built-in download function. This is on Mac OS X 10.7.5 using the following mono: MonoFramework-MRE-3.0.3.macos10.xamarin.x86.

data.title: Automatically collect crash reports
data.body:
There should be a method to automatize bug-reporting with useful logs and system information attached automatically to counter useless bug-reports with vital information missing. No one reads FAQs. For desync the system should automatically collect the sync report logs and do a diff. Only the diff is then uploaded to this bug tracker. For privacy reasons there should be an opt-out.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/100197-automatically-collect-crash-reports?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add unique game-ids
data.body:
Server should compute a game-id (via Guid.NewGuid, or similar) and stash it in the LobbyInfo.

This will allow us to automatically correlate syncreports by game, when we start collecting them.

data.title: Allow for special lighting
data.body:
This might be a little farfetched, but if we could implement dynamic lighting like in RA2 or TS, this would make our game much better.

What I would like to see is two things: A "Map Tint" feature that basically sets every unit, terrain, and building to have an RGBA value added to it. For example, if I wanted a "night" map, I could add b=79, and all units, terrain, and buildings will be tinted with this colour. 

And finally, the ability to add "lightposts" and "spotlights" that would set a certain lighting value either in a certain radius, or at a specific spot.

data.title: OpenRA should not rely on a single server
data.body:
Right now, if the master server goes down for some reason, multiplayer games are much harder to create.

The option to set "backup servers" in the YAML files as a "just in case" should be available. This would also allow for Tournament Servers, servers for a specific mod, and much more.
